prelude.description: Discover your new favorite meal with Traeger ribs. Simple and satisfying, these easy-to-make ribs start by smoking low n' slow, then get wrapped in foil and smothered in BBQ sauce for the perfect finish.

images.description: Smoked baby back ribs with BBQ sauce

steps.description: Peel membrane from the back side of ribs and trim any excess fat.
Season both sides of ribs with Traeger Pork & Poultry Rub, about 1/4 cup per rack.
When ready to cook, set smoker temperature to 180°F and preheat, lid closed for 15 minutes.
Place ribs on the grill and smoke for 3 to 4 hours.
When the internal temperature registers between 160°F to 165°F, remove ribs from the grill and increase smoker temperature to 350°F.
Place about 1/4 cup of Traeger 'Que BBQ Sauce on a large sheet of heavy-duty aluminum foil, then place a rack of ribs meat-side down on top and wrap tightly. Repeat with each rack.
Place the wrapped ribs back on the grill and cook for 45 minutes, or until internal temperature registers 204°F.
Remove from grill and let rest 20 minutes before slicing. Enjoy!
